history.content:
I'm pretty sure you should contact the financial aid office about this since your waiver was submitted to them.

----------------------------------------------

Generally, the fee remission does take a while to come through--in my experience and the experience of other TAs I've talked to, it normally comes in only a couple days before the CNP policy would take effect (meaning you shouldn't be too concerned that it hasn't shown up yet).  So you in effect need to play a game of chicken with the university, cause go bears.
I'm pretty sure you should contact the financial aid office about this since your waiver was submitted to them.

children.subject: I mean yeah you can email the EECS department, but the best answer you'll receive is either "yes we submitted it". If your concern is whether or not you'll need to find other means to pay the 20% minimum, it would probably be better to contact finaid since they'll be able to tell you if the waiver will get processed in time. That's just my two cents though
oops ignore the either in the first sentence
Who can I email to verify it was submitted?
I don't have confirmation my waiver was submitted, and my hiring email said to contact the department, not the FinAid office, which is why I'm asking here.

history.content:
I was hired a few weeks ago, but I haven't seen my tuition waiver process onto CalCentral and am wondering if I should find other resources to pay the 20% for CNP to avoid getting dropped, or if the waiver will show up soon (I know FinAid doesn't dispurse until at least 10 days before the semester starts, but the waiver isn't in my 'your awards' section in My Finances even though other awards/waivers are)

The hiring email I recieved said to "contact your hiring department with questions", but had no specific email address to reach anyone; who should I talk to?

Thanks!
history.subject: Who should I contact re: GSI tuition waiver processing?
